column4: Anybody good with rsync? Curious how I can set up an exclude list. Is it just --exclude-from=/path/to/exclude/list?
-C, --cvs-exclude
or: -f, --filter=RULE        This option allows you to add rules to selectively exclude certain files from the list of files to be transferred
or --exclude=PATTERN   or: --exclude-from=FILE
I just want to set up a list so I can clean up my command. That way instead of having 20 --exclude's I can have 20 items in a file, and reference the file in my command.
well man rsync confirms that what you mentioned is one possible way to acchieve that
yes, I've been in man rsync. But I'm not sure why my command isn't working. Hence why I was asking for further clarification on it.
different situation:what exactly isnt working? does it do nothing owr what happens?
the output errors out on a specific item because I don't have permissions to it. So I excluded it, but it's still erroring out
for some reason it's still "included" in the command.
try instead of the path to the file to use a simple "-" which will prompt you for the files to omit, and see what happens then?
yes, but then I have to exclude 20 items. that negates the point.
do it only for ONE and see what happens
it works if I do it individually. It does not work if I use the exclude list. that's why I'm asking for clarification on... the exclude list...
no need to be neither impatient nor cynical dude, if you want me to stop trying to help you just say the word...
I'm simply saying, what you're suggesting I've already done. I feel as though I stressed that several times.
I just need clarification with the exclude list. Not individual items. Just the exclude list.

you said you didnt want to write 20 exclude patterns in one commandline, well i was under the impression that writing something to a command line is something different thyn to be prompted for it, but since you seem to know better i will take myself out of the equasion, maxybe you can annoy somebody else...
That sounds best. After all, I'm looking for clarification on the matter, which would suggest I would need to talk to somebody with more experience. Thanks for your time.
maybe you also need a session with a psychologist on your anger issues? please dont talk to me any further
lol. You're taking it a bit too far for this channel my friend. Once again, just looking for some help on the issue. As I said, thanks for your time. :D
have a good day bro
